techmeme.title: Chinese AI lab DeepSeek debuts DeepSeek-R1, an MIT-licensed model that does well with math, code, and reasoning tasks, alongside other open and distilled models (Simon Willison/Simon Willison's Weblog)
Democratic Republic of Congo lawyers say Belgium has started a criminal probe into allegations that Apple has knowingly sourced "blood minerals" from the DRC (Financial Times)
Meta says it will continue to use its fact checkers outside of the US "for now", and plans to see how its Community Notes system works in the US before deciding (Jillian Deutsch/Bloomberg)
The European Commission says Facebook, X, YouTube, and others agreed to an updated code of conduct, first set up in May 2016, over hate speech under the DSA (Foo Yun Chee/Reuters)
China suggests it is willing to work with Donald Trump to keep TikTok operating in the US, after previously saying that it would block any forced sale of TikTok (Wall Street Journal)
